name: Chloe Bernstein
life_stage: 2 years post-grad, building career and social life simultaneously
relevant_history: Uses Instagram, Eventbrite, Google, and 3 group chats to find plans. Spends 30+ min researching most weekends.
emotional_baseline: Mildly anxious about wasting weekends but too tired to fix the process
in_their_voice: I have 14 tabs open right now trying to figure out Saturday and I still don't know what we're doing.

name: Aaliyah Johnson
life_stage: 3 years in NYC, large friend group scattered across boroughs
relevant_history: Has bookmarked 200+ saved posts on Instagram she'll never revisit. Tried Fever once, found it gimmicky.
emotional_baseline: Energetic but scattered — excited about possibilities, paralyzed by choices
in_their_voice: By the time I finish researching, I don't even want to go anymore.

name: Mei-Lin Wu
life_stage: Recently promoted, more disposable income but less free time
relevant_history: Made a Google Sheet of 'things to do in NYC' that's now 6 months stale. Still references it.
emotional_baseline: Frustrated that planning feels like a second job
in_their_voice: I feel like I'm personally responsible if the plan is bad, so I over-research everything.

name: Omar Farouk
life_stage: Living with roommates, socially active but time-poor
relevant_history: The friend who sends options to the group chat. 50% of the time nobody responds and plans fall through.
emotional_baseline: Optimistic but running out of patience with the current approach
in_their_voice: Why is it so hard to find out what's actually happening this weekend?

name: Tamika Harris
life_stage: Moved to NYC for work, friend group mostly from college
relevant_history: Subscribed to 4 NYC newsletters. Skims them Monday morning, forgets by Thursday.
emotional_baseline: Mildly anxious about wasting weekends but too tired to fix the process
in_their_voice: I have 14 tabs open right now trying to figure out Saturday and I still don't know what we're doing.

name: Keiko Yamamoto
life_stage: Dating someone new, trying to find couple-friendly activities
relevant_history: Tried ClassPass for fitness but wants something similar for cultural activities.
emotional_baseline: Energetic but scattered — excited about possibilities, paralyzed by choices
in_their_voice: By the time I finish researching, I don't even want to go anymore.

name: Danielle Brooks
life_stage: Dating someone new, trying to find couple-friendly activities
relevant_history: Tried ClassPass for fitness but wants something similar for cultural activities.
emotional_baseline: Optimistic but running out of patience with the current approach
in_their_voice: Why is it so hard to find out what's actually happening this weekend?

name: Elena Petrov
life_stage: Goes out 4-5 nights a week but realizes it's the same 5 places
relevant_history: Plans form via group text. Someone suggests a place, 6 people show up. No platform involved.
emotional_baseline: Not unhappy, but vaguely aware they're in a rut
in_their_voice: We always end up at the same place. I love it, but also... is this all we do?

name: Amira Khalil
life_stage: The social connector in every group chat, always initiating plans
relevant_history: Knows every bar in the East Village. Wants to explore Brooklyn more but never gets around to it.
emotional_baseline: Energetic and social, just lacks variety in activities
in_their_voice: I know there's cool stuff happening but I never hear about it until it's over.

name: Darius Jackson
life_stage: Recently broke up, using social life to stay busy and meet new people
relevant_history: Tried to start a 'new thing every week' challenge with friends. Lasted 3 weeks.
emotional_baseline: Bored on a deeper level but fills time with familiar routines
in_their_voice: I'm the one who plans everything but I never plan anything actually new.

name: Natasha Ivanova
life_stage: Works irregular hours, plans form spontaneously
relevant_history: The person who says 'we should do something different' and then suggests the same bar.
emotional_baseline: Wants to be the person who finds cool things, not just the person who organizes
in_their_voice: Saturday morning I have all this energy to do something different and by 2pm I'm back at brunch.

name: Marcus Thompson
life_stage: Has lived in NYC 4+ years, knows their neighborhood cold but rarely leaves it
relevant_history: Follows NYC lifestyle accounts on Instagram but rarely acts on the posts.
emotional_baseline: Not unhappy, but vaguely aware they're in a rut
in_their_voice: We always end up at the same place. I love it, but also... is this all we do?

name: Morgan Reilly
life_stage: Trying to shift from nightlife to daytime activities
relevant_history: Has a mental list of 'someday' activities that never becomes 'this weekend.'
emotional_baseline: Energetic and social, just lacks variety in activities
in_their_voice: I know there's cool stuff happening but I never hear about it until it's over.

name: Renée Dubois
life_stage: Trying to shift from nightlife to daytime activities
relevant_history: Has a mental list of 'someday' activities that never becomes 'this weekend.'
emotional_baseline: Wants to be the person who finds cool things, not just the person who organizes
in_their_voice: Saturday morning I have all this energy to do something different and by 2pm I'm back at brunch.

name: Andre Williams
life_stage: Introverted but not antisocial — has a small, close friend group
relevant_history: Has a private Google Maps list called 'Actually Good' with 40 pins. Tells nobody about it.
emotional_baseline: Quietly frustrated by the effort required to find quality experiences
in_their_voice: I don't need more options. I need someone to just tell me the 2 good ones.

name: Kira Johansson
life_stage: Lives alone, values solitude, but wants 1-2 quality outings per week
relevant_history: Went to a viral TikTok bar once. Loud, chaotic, overpriced. Never again.
emotional_baseline: Protective of favorite spots, wary of anything that feels mass-market
in_their_voice: If it went viral on TikTok, I'm already suspicious.

name: Adrienne Cole
life_stage: Moved to NYC for work, still building a social circle slowly
relevant_history: Trusts exactly 3 friends for recommendations. Ignores everything else.
emotional_baseline: Analytical about decision-making, drained by vibe-checking online
in_their_voice: The mental load before the fun is the actual problem. The fun part is fine.

name: Olivia Santos
life_stage: In a long-term relationship, looking for low-key date activities
relevant_history: Researches a restaurant for 20 minutes before going. Checks photos, reviews, menu, vibe.
emotional_baseline: Content with routine but occasionally wants to discover something new without the research tax
in_their_voice: I'd rather go to one great place than bounce between three mediocre ones.

name: Tara Patel
life_stage: Works remotely, weekends are the main social outlet
relevant_history: Deleted Instagram. Finds things through Google Maps and one trusted newsletter.
emotional_baseline: Quietly frustrated by the effort required to find quality experiences
in_their_voice: I don't need more options. I need someone to just tell me the 2 good ones.

name: Raj Patel
life_stage: Prefers reading, museums, and quiet bars over clubs and concerts
relevant_history: Has strong opinions about which neighborhoods are 'real' vs tourist traps.
emotional_baseline: Protective of favorite spots, wary of anything that feels mass-market
in_their_voice: If it went viral on TikTok, I'm already suspicious.

emotional_baseline: Content with routine but occasionally wants to discover something new without the research tax
in_their_voice: I'd rather go to one great place than bounce between three mediocre ones.

name: Rachel Park
life_stage: Actively wants novelty and cultural exposure, growth-oriented
relevant_history: Discovers exhibitions through Instagram stories. By the time she clicks, it says 'closing this Sunday.'
emotional_baseline: Curious and motivated but frustrated by information asymmetry
in_their_voice: I didn't know this thing existed and I would have gone if someone just told me.

name: Tomás Guerrero
life_stage: Moved to NYC specifically for the cultural scene
relevant_history: Went to the Van Gogh immersive experience and loved it. Wants more of that but doesn't know how to find it.
emotional_baseline: Feels like NYC has so much to offer and she's only scratching the surface
in_their_voice: Why do I always find out about cool things the day they close?

name: Zara Osei
life_stage: Career in creative industry, social life overlaps with professional interests
relevant_history: Follows 30+ NYC culture accounts. Information overload but still misses things.
emotional_baseline: Excited by ephemeral events, anxious about missing them
in_their_voice: Instagram is random. I want to actively search for what's happening, not wait for the algorithm.

name: Esme Blackwell
life_stage: Has disposable income, willing to spend on experiences
relevant_history: Tried Time Out NYC. Too broad, too many restaurant listicles, not enough cultural programming.
emotional_baseline: Wants an intentional discovery tool, not another feed to scroll
in_their_voice: I want to be the person who knows about the pop-up before everyone else.

name: Nikolai Volkov
life_stage: Follows gallery openings and pop-ups but finds out about half of them too late
relevant_history: Has a friend who always knows about pop-ups. Wishes she could replicate that knowledge.
emotional_baseline: Curious and motivated but frustrated by information asymmetry
in_their_voice: I didn't know this thing existed and I would have gone if someone just told me.

name: Courtney Ng
life_stage: Wants to be more intentional about cultural exploration
relevant_history: Missed a Kehinde Wiley show because she didn't know it was closing. Still annoyed.
emotional_baseline: Feels like NYC has so much to offer and she's only scratching the surface
in_their_voice: Why do I always find out about cool things the day they close?

life_stage: Wants to be more intentional about cultural exploration
relevant_history: Missed a Kehinde Wiley show because she didn't know it was closing. Still annoyed.
emotional_baseline: Wants an intentional discovery tool, not another feed to scroll
in_their_voice: I want to be the person who knows about the pop-up before everyone else.

name: Nkechi Okafor
life_stage: Recently moved to NYC, adjusting to the cost of everything
relevant_history: Googled 'free things to do in NYC' and got a list of 200 random events, half expired.
emotional_baseline: Anxious about money but doesn't want it to define social life
in_their_voice: I don't mind spending money but I mind feeling like I have to spend money just to hang out.

name: David Kim
life_stage: Earns enough to survive but socializing feels like a luxury
relevant_history: Went to a 'free' event that turned out to be a sales pitch with a cash bar.
emotional_baseline: Resourceful and creative, just needs better signal on quality free options
in_their_voice: Free in NYC usually means 'not actually fun.' I need someone to filter the good free stuff.

name: Hannah Kim
life_stage: Has student loans, budgets carefully, but doesn't want to be a hermit
relevant_history: Uses Beli for food but nothing equivalent for activities.
emotional_baseline: Feels left out when friends suggest expensive activities
in_their_voice: My friends all want to go to $20-cover bars. I just want to do something that doesn't cost anything.

name: Kwame Asante
life_stage: Came from a smaller city where hanging out didn't cost $40 minimum
relevant_history: Friends suggest cocktail bars that cost $18/drink. Feels pressure to keep up.
emotional_baseline: Optimistic about NYC but financially stressed
in_their_voice: I moved here for the city, not to sit in my apartment because everything is expensive.

name: Jasmine Wright
life_stage: Lives with 2-3 roommates to afford rent, social life is important for sanity
relevant_history: Found one good free gallery through a friend. Wishes there were a way to find more like that.
emotional_baseline: Anxious about money but doesn't want it to define social life
in_their_voice: I don't mind spending money but I mind feeling like I have to spend money just to hang out.

name: Grace Tanaka
life_stage: First year in NYC, still figuring out where to find affordable fun
relevant_history: Tried Eventbrite's free filter. Quality was wildly inconsistent.
emotional_baseline: Resourceful and creative, just needs better signal on quality free options
in_their_voice: Free in NYC usually means 'not actually fun.' I need someone to filter the good free stuff.
